info.title: Elements Supply API
info.summary: Canonical contract for the Elements Supply public API.
info.description:
Elements Supply is a multi-tenant sourcing and procurement platform that exposes a single
public API for authenticated buyers, suppliers, and platform administrators. All responses
are wrapped in the standard envelope documented in `/docs/API_ENVELOPE.md` and conform to
the schemas defined in this spec. Unless noted otherwise, every path requires either a
bearer token (Sanctum personal access token) or an API key issued by the platform admin
console. Date/time fields are returned in ISO 8601 format using the company-configured
timezone and include UTC offsets.

tags.name: Auth
tags.description: Authentication session management and API key usage.

tags.name: Companies & Plans
tags.description: Company provisioning, billing plans, and entitlements.

tags.name: RFQs
tags.description: Manage requests for quotation and related supplier interactions.

tags.name: Quotes
tags.description: Quote submission, revision, and award workflows.

tags.name: Purchase Orders
tags.description: Purchase order lifecycle, change orders, and totals.

tags.name: Credit Notes
tags.description: Credit note issuance, application, and reversal.

tags.name: Inventory
tags.description: Goods receipt, issues, adjustments, and warehouse movements.

tags.name: Exports
tags.description: Bulk data export creation and download.

tags.name: Localization
tags.description: Localization settings, units of measure, and conversions.

tags.name: Money & Tax
tags.description: Monetary settings, FX rates, and tax configuration.

tags.name: Admin
tags.description: Platform administration (plans, feature flags, API keys, rate limits, health).

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Outbound webhook subscription formats and delivery expectations.

tags.name: Search
tags.description: Global search and contextual filtering for tenants.

bearerAuth.description:
Supply a bearer token acquired via Sanctum. All tokens are scoped to a specific
company tenant and inherit the permissions assigned to the issuing user.

apiKeyAuth.name: X-API-Key
apiKeyAuth.description:
API keys are issued and rotated in the platform admin console. Include the value in the
`X-API-Key` header to authenticate machine-to-machine integrations.

XRequestId.name: X-Request-Id
XRequestId.description: Correlates requests across services. Echoed back on every response when supplied.

AcceptLanguage.name: Accept-Language
AcceptLanguage.description: Overrides language resolution when localization features are enabled.

XRequestId.description: Unique identifier for the current request.

XRateLimitLimit.description: Maximum number of requests allowed in the current window.

XRateLimitRemaining.description: Remaining requests available in the current window.

XRateLimitReset.description: Seconds until the current rate limit window resets.

XTraceId.description: Internal trace identifier for support escalations.

errors.description: Field-level validation errors keyed by attribute.

request_id.description: Echoed from `X-Request-Id` when supplied; otherwise generated server-side.

pagination.description: Pagination details when the response is a collection.

next_cursor.description: TODO: clarify if deprecated in favor of pagination.oneOf per spec.

prev_cursor.description: TODO: clarify if deprecated in favor of pagination.oneOf per spec.

Money.description: Monetary amount with major/minor units. Mixed document currencies are not permitted.

amount.description: Major units rendered according to the company currency format.

amount_minor.description: Minor units (cents) aligned with ISO-4217 exponent.

currency.description: ISO-4217 currency code. All items in a document share the same currency.

Timeline.description: Timestamps captured in company timezone with UTC offsets.

ErrorExamples.description: TODO: consolidate reusable error examples per module.

git_hash.description: Git commit deployed; null in local development.

CompanyResource.description: TODO: flesh out company schema per /docs/DOMAIN_MODEL.md.

meta.description: TODO: clarify meta fields (e.g. compliance flags, custom properties).

specs.description: Raw JSON specs captured during RFQ creation.

attachments.description: TODO: normalize attachment schema with documents module.
Document IDs produced by the documents API.

attachments[].description: TODO: confirm attachment field naming convention for file uploads.

QuoteSummaryResource.description: Summary projection used on RFQ quote tab.

Forbidden.description: Authenticated but lacking required permissions or tenant entitlements.

get.description: Lightweight readiness probe used by load balancers and the admin console.
Returns the compiled OpenAPI JSON artifact produced by the `api:spec:build` command.
Returns the Postman collection generated from the compiled OpenAPI document.

post.description: TODO: clarify onboarding payload per requirements.

get.description: Returns RFQs scoped to the authenticated company with pagination, filtering, and tenant-safe envelopes.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: FULLTEXT search against RFQ title and item descriptions.

post.description: Creates a draft RFQ. Attachments must adhere to RFQ document rules in `/deep-specs/documents.md`.

put.description: Updates a draft or opens a new version according to RFQ versioning rules.

delete.description: Cancels the RFQ and performs a soft delete per tenant policy.

200.description: Clarification thread ordered by creation date.

post.description: Awards an RFQ to a supplier, locking further edits.
Creates or updates RFQ line awards when partial awards are enabled.

get.summary: List change orders for purchase order

200.description: Current change orders for the PO.

get.summary: List invoices for a purchase order

200.description: Paginated invoices linked to the purchase order.

get.summary: List goods receipt notes for purchase order

200.description: Paginated export requests for the current company.
Current locale configuration for the company.

get.summary: Convert quantity using part base unit

200.description: Paginated history of webhook delivery attempts.
